When it comes to stores that are in your corner as a gun owner, these guys are bar none best of the best in our area.

name: pauline bracken
text: Sarah did a fantastic job teaching me how to firearm! I actually would give her 10 ⭐️ Since I haven’t in years!! I probably will take another class before I actually buy a pistol! Thank you again for your patience and spending over 2 hours with me! I had a wonderful time!!

name: Steven Gaffin
text:
I went because I was having the hardest time removing the retaining pin from the firing pin of my Remington 870. So I took the bolt down to Bullet and Barrel. Front Desk (not really front more like back left corner) staff was very welcoming and friendly. The gunsmith was able to remove the pin and lathe down a manufacturing defect in it that was keeping it in the bolt.
I was very satisfied and impressed with Bullet and Barrel and will definitely return for the many other services they offer.

name: Catherine Stower
text: Sarah was a wonderful instructor!  Her patience went above and beyond what I would have expected from an instructor, and her knowledge is tremendous.  In addition, she is continuing to work with me to help me figure out the best firearm for personal use.

name: MaryAnn Green
text: Took a beginner's gun safety class.  Sarah was my instructor and was extremely knowlegeable.  She answered all my questions and gave me good advise on how to properly handle a fire arm.  She provided helpful hints on the firing range.  I plan on meeting with her again for more instruction.

name: Steve S
text: Excellent instruction and advice from Jeff White! He is extremely knowledgeable and taught me a ton of tips to correct my technique. Thank you so much! It's just a great facility. Clean, professional, helpful.

name: Ethan Brewer
text: Alberto is the man. Great customer service. We talked about many different guns. He knew the product, and I could tell he was genuinely trying to help me.

name: Eugene Mayo
text: My first visit to Bullet & Barrel was a very pleasant experience. I expected the normal indoor gun range with no frills and a lack of management personnel for the amount of customers. Not at Bullet & Barrel! You enter the establishment and find yourself in a first class gun store with very tastefully displayed products. When you check in to the range most of the paper work is done electronically and there are plenty of well trained staff on hand to help you, not only at check in but on the range also. Defiantly not a Mom & Pops business. Top notch!

name: J Cowan
text: Great place for learning how to shoot or just for practice. My husband and I visited and enjoyed it. Truly learned at lot from our instructor Sarah. She was very knowledgeable and very patient. We learned so much. She walked through every detail with us together and separately, as we each own two different guns. Highly recommend! Thank you Sarah!! We will be back.

name: Dorothy Loftin
text: Thank you Tim for a great lesson on learning to get comfortable with a gun! I was with my sister and friend, both of whom had experience with guns.  Tim tailored the class for all 3 of us with varying abilities.  I had never touched a gun and was shooting with multiple guns by the end of the session.  The best part of it all is now I’m comfortable with the gun we have in our home.  Thanks again Tim!  We will definitely be back for more lessons!

name: Randy Chavez
text: Went in the is morning for the first time to sight in my hunting rifles. WOW!  Got hooked up with George and he did it all. Helped me sight in four rifles is one hour, explained everything he was adjusting and just made the experience unbelievable. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Thanks George!

name: Emilee Taritero
text: My twins took the Youth Marksmanship Class  with Sarah as part of their 13th bday weekend. She was amazing! She was so patient with the group of kids. She explained everything very well and made sure the class understood all the points of gun safety and operation which allowed them to have an amazing time once they got the hands on experience on the range. My twins DID NOT want to leave.  We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you do much!!! Sarah is a great instructor! Please come visit us again soon!

name: vivaswanth c
text:
Great range. Courteous people and very encouraging trainers.
Modern equipment and look. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Please come back and visit soon :)

name: Nelly Belly
text: Best range in Huntsville.... and it’s not even close. I became a member when they were still building it because I knew it would be a great place and they have exceeded my expectations. The ranges are well lit and spotless. The thickness of the barriers between the ranges was a major selling point to me. I feel safe and secure when I am on my lane. The range masters are helpful and add another layer of protection for the customers/ members that are throwing lead at a target. I strongly suggest you give Bullet and Barrel a shot (pun intended) if you are looking for a place to shoot. Beware, this place can become addictive.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your continued support

name: diane rigsby
text: A friend and I took the first steps class from instructor Sarah.  Sarah gave great instruction emphasizing safety first.  She was very patient.  I learned A lot and will go back in the future.  Also the facility was very clean.

name: Jasmine Tucker
text: If you’ve heard about this place and have not stop by, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? This place is awesome! It’s clean, and there’s safety videos which made me feel safe and my favorite part was that the staff made me feel comfortable. I encountered Sarah who is so patient and knowledgeable. This was my first time using my new .380 and she encouraged me to practice more with it and not be discouraged. Just when I thought the place couldn’t get any better I even had the same experience as I exited by Pam she’s so sweet she explained to me about how to become a member. This place sells everything too!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! Please come back soon 😃

name: Larry Parker
text: Excellent facility. Great instruction on gun safety and usage from Jeff White. Highly recommend Jeff for a private or group lesson.

resp.text: Jeff does an awesome job!!!! Please come visit us again soon!!! And let us know if we can help you further

name: Ivica Ristovski
text: This is a very good place. Staff is super nice. Clean building, very nice shooting range. I would say best in town. Perfect for pistol shooting.

resp.text: Thank you!! All of lanes are also rifle rated as well!

name: Clint Beavers
text: The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Sarah answered all my questions, demonstrated gun safety, and made my first time experience an enjoyable one.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!!! Sarah is a great part of the team! Please come see us again soon

name: Zachary Talley
text: This is the best gun shop in Alabama. Fastest and most professional service. I dropped my gun off with new scope John amd Alberto had all the necessary mounting hardware in stock.  1 hour they mounted ,bore sighted and zeroed in at there 100 yard range. EXCELLENT SERVICE and very well trained gun smith and employees.

name: FryingPan
text: Got a membership to this place and its worth every penny. Excellent range officers and all very professional. The ranges themselves are very clean and ventilated. There is ample space for any weapons you want to bring. They have a huge selection of weapons to rent (free with membership) which was one of the big selling points of the membership for me. Once you shoot here you won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank so much! We appreciate you joining the family!

name: braxton guthrie
text: Extremely respectful over the phone was very refreshing, normally because of my age (21) I'm in between being treated as an adult and an adult.

name: david schachle
text: If you are looking to learn how to shoot, I highly reccomend Jeff. He is very nice and profesional. They have a clean range and store. Very fun experience.

name: Bryson Hill
text:
After going to three other places in Huntsville and the big box store across from Bridge street that has the street named after them along with there sales add and waiting in line for hour two find out that they did not have one or ever had one.
For now on Bullet and Barrel has my business best prices in town Thomas was my sales person he was a great help . Everyone was very nice I encourage anyone that is in the market for firearm visit Bullet and Barrel

name: donald reimer
text: Very clean, safe and very nice range people are very helpful and friendly no attitude will definitely return when back in town

resp.text: Come back and see us! Travel safe

name: Charles Pruitt
text: The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the gun range is awesome. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, if you're looking for a place to shoot, try them out. They've definitely earned my business.

name: Galvin Freeman
text: First visit here to shoot and I was very, very impressed with the entire staff from start to finish! This place has that it factor and has lots of potential to become a gem here in Huntsville! The indoor range takes it to another level. Definitely recommend checking this place out! You won't be disappointed! I enjoyed my visit and will be back.

resp.text: Please come back soon!

name: J B
text:
First, I must say that the range facilities are quite nice with helpful staff. The range facilities are up to date, very comfortable and the RSOs are very professional.

However, I made the mistake of using the gunsmith services. This has not gone well. This particular saga has been going on since the end of November. I always had to call or email them to get any status and the answer was always the same...it will be ready Saturday, it will be ready next week, it will be ready "sometime next week". I do not believe that they have devoted any significant time to my project. The first time I checked in with them after a week, that is when they informed me I needed to bring in other components. They never reached out to me. Very frustrating. Now that it is in Jan I have given up working with them and I am now taking the project somewhere else.

I get the feeling that they want to work on things when they feel like it, have no obligation to provide status or time estimate to the customer. Furthermore, I do not believe that they have fulltime gunsmiths which feels a little misleading from the website.

So if any readers know a professional, hardworking gunsmith in the area I am certainly looking!

resp.text: Hey JB! we're so sorry this was your experience. Normally our Gunsmiths can offer quick turn around times. Some thing may change that with parts availability and waiting on other parts we need from our customers. I am sorry we were back logged at the time and when we received your receiver in late December we began to diagnose the problem. But again that's no excuse for a lack of communication. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance

name: Andre Harris II
text:
Went to buy a light for my handgun and I received quick and friendly service. I was also lucky enough to receive a small discount while I was there.
Clean and an open environment also

name: Ethan Owens
text: A truly epic indoor shooting range. Truly the best in Alabama. Seriously. Plus I don’t have to worry about lead poisoning or negligent discharges by employees. They’re prices are really decent as well. Not the cheapest but well worth the price because of the great value they represent.

name: Sara Bozeman
text: Jerrell, the gunsmith, literally saved my weekend. I went in on a Friday needing to sight in a new rifle before going hunting for the weekend. My mounts were machines improperly and couldn’t hold a zero. Jerrell skipped his lunch to fix my mounts, and did an amazing job. The rest of the staff was very helpful, kind, and generous with advice. I love how clean and fresh the facilities are as well. Not many gun ranges are so well kept! I’ll be going back, and definitely using Jerrell for any work I need done on a gun.

resp.text: We love our gunsmiths!!! Please come back and see ya soon!  😀

name: Kenyon Stone
text: Such a great place! Staff very helpful and friendly. Brought a 12 year old, they had some options for her, and were making sure she enjoyed herself as well. Tim was a great help, felt very welcome

name: Caitlin Thomas
text: Such an enjoyable experience.  Highly recommend Bullet & Barrel

name: Destiny Freeman
text: We had such a great time here! Friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive staff. The range and facilities are very well maintained and clean. Wonderful range and personable people. Win win. Thank you!

name: DAN From the SOUTH
text: This is by far my favorite shooting range to use in Huntsville! Very friendly environment and extremely kid friendly. My son always says "Bullet and Barrel" when I ask him where he wants to go!! Well done guys!

resp.text: Thanks!!!! We like to think we're all a big family 😀😀😀

name: Matt Ray
text: No better place in Huntsville to buy a silencer.  You can even use it in the range while waiting on the government.  Silencer shop kiosk makes the process super simple, and the staff are excellent to work with.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Mike K
text: I took Louis up on his offer of a tour of Bullet and Barrel as my previous experience was less than stellar.  The experience this time was quite the opposite of my last visit; even before I met Louis.  I was greeted as soon as I entered the building and was pointed in the right direction to meet Louis.  The tour was thorough, and as suspected the facilities are top notch, and they offered quite a bit more than I expected.  The gun range is state of the art and the RSO's are extremely helpful.  The staff is friendly, professional and quite knowledgeable .  Thank you Louis, and the entire Bullet and Barrel staff for an exceptional experience.  I most definitely will be back.

resp.text: Mike, I am so sorry that this is what you experienced with us today. We pride ourselves on giving our customers an awesome experience. As our reviews reflect that this is not our norm. But I'd love to personally invite you back and I'll give you a behind the scenes tour of our facility. Thank you for the feedback and we truly hope we can deliver a 5-star response on you next visit. If you'd like to set this up my personal email is louis@bulletandbarrel.com~ Louis, General Manager

name: Rick Morgan
text:
Jason did an excellent job teaching me how to shoot. He caught and corrected all my aiming problems.
A really great teacher!

name: Thomas Webber
text: I have been to Bullet and Barrel many times. Always a great time and the staff treat you right. Best place in Huntsville!!!

name: Danta Simonsen
text: My son and I took a gun safety class and had a great time. The instructors were knowledgeable and made the class fun without loosing the seriousness of what we were there to learn. Tim took extra time to help my son making him feel confident. He was very encouraging no matter how bad my aim was. Excellent service, great facilitie. Highly recommend.

name: Michael Mauro
text: Hands down, the best Gun Range I've ever visited. I've lived across 5 states and have visited ranges in each one. This one has, by far, exceeded my expectations in all areas. The staff are immensely helpful, friendly and professional. Thank you for your clean facility and expert staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!!!! And for bringing us some cool guns to work on~louis

name: Bridgette Bradley
text: We had our corporate event here. The employees were simply wonderful! Everyone was very knowledgeable and cared about each person in attendance. The facility is immaculate! The shooting range itself is the best in Huntsville. Highly recommend Bullet and Barrel!!

name: Jacob Boyett
text: Went in as a newbie shooter and within 2 minutes of being in the range Dave stepped up and immediately told me things I could correct and even went so far as to give me some drills to run. I would recommend Dave and B&B to anybody. See you guys next week!

name: Barrett Eimer
text: Great range to shoot at with nice lanes and technology; they have a decent selection of quality guns and rifles too. They also sell apparel for men and women.  It comes together as a welcome and unique blend of ideas for a place to shop.  There is a ton of space and it will be cool to see how they intend to make use of it all.

name: Weston Hall
text: What a fun professional place! Very clean and the staff was very friendly. They weren’t intimidating and was nice when I asked them questions.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please visit us again soon!!

name: Ira Merritt
text: I have used the range at B&B  a number of times and the staff is always friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and safety conscious. I also recently did a trade and had gun smithing done on an AR. My interactions have all been very satisfactory. John, the gunsmith, and others went far out of their way to resolve a non-standard hardware problem in a way that I greatly appreciated. Great staff and operation.

name: Jay Graham
text: My wife and I shot guns for the first time. We had an excellent experience. We took a personal class from Colt, a fantastic instructor! He is very knowledgeable, explains things clearly, and kept us feeling confident throughout the entire process. We're already looking forward to our next visit.

name: Miki Heaton
text: First time to visit this range, very nice facility and clean well maintained range. I would have given it 5 stars if not for two things. When we walked in the door two employees behind the counter were on their cell phones and didn’t look up until we spoke. Then when we walked on the range the range officer was also on his phone. In each case neither were talking only looking at the screen.  I personally have a problem with employees being on their phones at work but on a firing range just seems like a really bad idea.

name: Will Booker
text: I drove all the way across town to get there still in line for 5-10 minutes they let two people in front of me go on to the range and then told me that they just took the last person on the range and turned me away. It wasn't covered related because they weren't busy. I won't be going back thanks for nothing

resp.text: Thank for leaving this feedback! As you can see typically the strong majority of our guests have 5 star experiences. Talking this over with our team we looked back at your trip. We do have a pretty firm rule on not allowing shooters on the range 30 minutes before we close. The folks who went ahead of you are some of our members and one of their perks is lane priority. We would absolutely love for you to give us another chance and I would like to invite you back as my guest and comp you your range time. ~Louis S.

name: Matt White
text: I am so happy with the experience I had shopping for my gun parts and my new purchase of the noveske space invader! They have answered every question that I have had. I usually give a name to ask for but theres no need in this best gun/shooting range in north alabama! Everyone is very knowledgeable. This place is amazing!

name: Matt Hamblin
text: Great staff and an amazing range. Oozes professionalism and safety. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Come visit us again soon

name: Ariel Eisenstadt
text: Lots of fun, friendly staff very helpful. Terrific selection of rental firearms very fair pricing

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! Please come visit us again soon and if there is anything we can do please let us know~Louis

name: Pat Shores
text: Great place to shoot!  Awesome service and staff especially the range officers.  They were both friendly and helpful all while being professional.  This was my first trip but it sure won’t be my last!

name: Seth Webb
text: These is the best range in North AL. The range is well lit, climate controlled, and each lane is very spacious. But the best part are the people who work here. I cannot give enough praise for my favorite place in Huntsville.

name: Ron Volinski
text: First time at a gun range. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Very nice place and the people are friendly and attentive.  Jason was really great with helping me with gun control and site alignment.  Great experience!

name: Caleb Hollingsworth
text: Never thought I would go to an indoor range again after a poor experience at Larry's range. The range here is nice and well lighted! Love it!

resp.text: Thank you! Come visit during the holidays!

name: tim watson
text: Nice and friendly staff. Clean and well run. Will definitely go there again.

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! Merry Christmas and we look forward to seeing you soon

name: alfred keely
text: The facilities are very nice, clean,  and comfortable. The staff are also very nice, and knowledgeable. It was an outstanding experience. My wife and I will be back.

name: Tom Copeland
text: Great place.Great people. Wouldn't think of going anywhere else.

name: Wayne Roddy
text: This a real nice place. The staff is very friendly, the decor and range is super clean.

resp.text: Thank you so much Wayne!!! Please come back soon

name: Mandi Harbour
text: Me && my husband went today and talked with a guy name Jeff. Let’s just say we WILL NOT be going back. He was rude and his costumer service was trash 🗑 this place won’t last long at all with the prices and the non friendly staff such as Jeff!

resp.text: I do apologise that this was your experience! This is so strange to hear because Jeff is one of our most lauded employees. Although we do apologise that we didn't meet your expectations I'd love to discuss your experience. Please call me on Tuesday at 256-384-4867 ~Louis GM

name: Jack Stripling
text: This place is awesome! Loved the rifle range. Great experience. I'll be back!

name: Anthony Williams
text: Came in looking for a gun that they had out of stock. One of the workers really helped me  out by looking for the weapon at other stores. Then helped me understand the paper work process. One thing that stuck out to me was friendly customer service and needs of the consumer met.

name: Louisa G
text: State of the art facility.  Super friendly and comfortable environment.

name: Paige Burchel
text: Precious ladies items - jackets, tees, hats, scarves, etc...not to be missed!

resp.text: Come again! We have a great sale going on!

name: Dean Hammer
text: Very clean place and helpful staff! Will return!

name: Dave Rausch
text: Well maintained facility & Staff

name: Jason Denny
text: You range does include a 100 yard range. However, put the fact that it is CLOSED ON MONDAYS on you site!!!  What a waste of time!

resp.text: Jason I am so sorry for the inconvenience. We are closed on Mondays so we can keep Bullet and Barrel to our high standard of a clean and safe range. However we do have our hours posted on our Website as well as here on Google and Facebook. But please come in tomorrow and we'll give you a 5 star experience

name: DM M (DMM)
text: Amazing!!

name: Susan Hoskins
text: Great place to visit!!!!!

name: Charlie Donner
text: Very nice

name: bwcritch
text: Great place, just don’t be an idiot. Keep in mind this is a pistol range, so don’t get butt hurt if the owner asks you a few questions for his liability. I love coming here to shoot when it’s either to hot or raining outside. I’ll keep coming here.

name: Maryl Bobinger
text: My family and I have been coming here for years. We absolutely love the range, and the customer service but more importantly the time Robert takes to make sure everyone knows their guns and more importantly gun safety. My husband and I have shot guns for years but our daughter didn't. He took the time to make sure our daughter was comfortable with our guns and gun safety! We have always gotten excellent service and are impressed by Roberts attention to detail when it comes to safety. I would NEVER want to go to a place that is lackadaisical in the importance of safety and that he is willing to turn away customers that may not take gun safety seriously. He takes the time to ask questions on your abilities and your knowledge of gun safety and is not afraid of turning someone away for the safety of others. I want to know that when I am in the lane next to someone they know what they are doing and practice proper gun safety. I don't want to accidentally get shot by someone who hasn't gone through a gun safety course and been properly trained. As a gun owner you should expect nothing less from your gun range! The extra time it takes to answer a few questions should be welcomed and not taken as a sign of disrespect. Customer service here is wonderful and welcomed!!!

name: Michelle Divinagracia
text: Came here with my husband who is an ex-Marine, 5time rifle expert, 2 time pistol expert. Rifle coach. Trained hundreds of marines. But he wasn’t qualified enough to be our safety observer. And I wasn’t allowed to shoot. So we left. He was also rude and insulting. Just another guy who was too fat to become a policeman or marine and thinks he’s Rambo because he has a rusty gun collection and a shack to shoot in.

name: Nick BRANDT
text: Roberts Gun Rack is a great gun shop and range. And aside from always having a selection of handguns and rifles, Robert also has good gun knowledge and a massive amount of tools for repairs and modifications; he has helped me numerous times!  Best of all, when your done working on your gun you can step into the range to function test and practice. Great local resource!

name: Carrie Bradley
text: I have been a customer for nearly 7 years, I love the atmosphere and the owner is always so helpful. There is a lot I don't understand about firearms,  and Robert is more than willing to take the time to explain things. There's was even a couple of times I didn't have all my safety gear, and was provided what I needed to do my session.

name: alonevin boyo
text: Great place and a great guy. Know this stuff and runs a safe range! If you need or want a gun, this is the guy to talk to!

name: Ryan B
text: Found this place a couple weeks ago and I have been going every Sunday since. Robert is very knowledgeable about guns and does require that you to have high level of experience or training to shoot at his range. Good selection of guns and probably the best prices around. If he doesn't have it he will find it. Military friendly!!!

name: Jeff Caraway
text:
Robert (owner/operator) runs a good business. He will go the extra mile to help customers if he can and is honest with them if he can't (which some people may not appreciate.) I shoot there regularly and plan to continue. He has a good selection of firearms and even has some for rent.

Full disclosure; I visit regularly even if I'm not shooting, we have a lot of laughs and I learn a lot just by listening. I watched Robert spend an hour helping a seasoned citizen select and purchase a firearm last night with great patience and understanding.

name: Kent Haughton
text: I have been doing business with Robert now for 4 years......So If you are looking to buy your 1st gun or your 100th? I strongly recommend that you go see Robert. Robert cares more about fitting you with a firearm that  you can really use, more than just "taking your money". My recommendation is go shop the big box stores 1st...... then go see Robert!.. Then you will see the difference! Robert is a professional. His ethics are on point.....As for the range, it is SAFETY 1st. Robert's prices are very reasonable. His Industry knowledge is unsurpassed and remember this...Robert will "tell it like it is". What more could you want when making a purchasing decision?...Especially a firearm. I find it amusing that some people posting reviews are offended by a business man taking his business seriously. Guns are not Toys and SAFETY must come 1st!

name: Lendon Webb
text: Great place to shop and learn. Spent hours with the owner and went home with a firearm that met my needs. Will definitely buy from him in the future.

name: Thaddeus Harkins
text:
Was denied access to the range because I don't count every single round I put through each one of my pistols. Person behind the counter said 1000 round minimum with pistol was required and more than that was required if I was going to have newer shooters with me. I had some family with me that were newer shooters but all of them had experience. I knew I had shot more than 1000 but I don't know how much more because no reasonable person keeps track of that. I also indicated I've had tens of thousands of rounds through rifles but that didn't matter to the person behind the counter. Went back through my purchase history and I now see I've bought 4000 rounds of 45acp and I've used up 3 of those cases. I've put 2 cases of 1000 through my tokarev. I don't keep track of my round count. 5000 rounds through pistols over the course of the 5 years I've owned them just seems like a drop in the bucket compared to the tens of thousands rounds I put through my rifles, so I had no idea how much I've put through them.

I politely asked if he knew of a range that was open (because it was a holiday) and he proceeded to tell he wasn't going to to tell us where we could go to do something stupid, implying that any one of us would be incapable of handling a firearm safely. Extremely condescending.

name: Cal Evans
text:
This is a good, no-frills range.  We met Robert, he' is a nice person. Asked up to confirm that we had shot before, had training, and knew what we were doing. Beyond that, we filled out the form and by the time the paperwork was finished, we had a line.

The range itself it not air conditioned. So if you are going in the summer, bring a towel. :) They do have small fans mounted above each lane that help. This isn't really a complaint, just a note.

If you are used to ranges like "Nashville Armory" then this isn't that kind of range. However, it is a good range and well run.

=C=

name: Jalisa Arrington
text: I visited this business for the first time on 12/30/17 to use the gun range. Everything started off fine, but I am offended by the owner of this business. I am a reservist in the United States Air Force. The owner of this business has a  posting on his website that states that active duty military members get a $5 discount. When it was time for me to check out, I asked about the military discount and he stated to me that because I do not work with my base 5 days a week, that I am not eligible for the discount and I was charged as a civilian. I was so hurt and offended, because I took the same oath as my other brothers and sisters to protect and defend! I could get deployed today and have to fight for the very person who does not look at me as a part of the military!  I was going to let it go, but I couldn't. I called the business this afternoon and expressed how I was offended. His defense was that he was told that a reservist in the military is basically nothing but a part time position. He did offer me a full refund, but I told him that it wasn't about the money for me. He needs to do more research on his own and take care of ALL military members or no one at all! I will not be going back! If you are reserve in the military, you are just another civilian in the eyes of this business owner!! Take your business elsewhere!

name: Tevin Richey
text: Roberts Gun Rack is like my second home. He’s extremely knowledgeable, and just a all around good guy. Great range, great prices, and most important to me great service. Definitely a customer for life.

name: Melanie Noname
text: I have been to this range several times and have always had a great experience. I see some people posting about strictness but it is a gun store as well as a range and I feel like I am safe there due to the rules that have been put into place. It definitely can't be run like a car wash with just anyone coming in and out of the range area. Will be returning probably many times over!!

name: Brandon Critchfield
text: First time I came here years ago I thought the place was so-so. Since then Robert has grown on me. He offers military discounts, friendly, enjoys a good chat. Sure you may be able to find other ranges, but his is indoors and much cheaper than others nearby. Some people do't like his interview process, but its his place of business so he can do as he pleases, but honestly the interview isn't squat. I like that when isn't a big deal to turn the lights down for low light drills and he isn't hanging over you during your entire range session breathing down your neck to jump criticize your shooting like other ranges I've shot at.

name: Justin Copeland
text: Robert is a master at his craft. I highly recommend him for any firearm needs you may have. He is very knowledgeable & his prices are fair.

name: Lisa Richey
text: Great experience at Roberts Gun Rack. Wasn't sure about this place after reading previous reviews. But after visiting today I would recommend this place

name: Lisa Richey
text: Great experience at Roberts Gun Rack. Wasn't sure about this place after reading previous reviews. But after visiting today I would recommend this place

name: Rodney Williams
text: Very knowledgeable and attentive. Takes safety very serious and is patient with new users. He made sure my fiancé was comfortable before allowing her to shoot.

name: Spencer Howell
text: Great place,great prices, great selection of quality products, and is willing to educate you. He will be very blunt with you, because he cares more about safety, than if he is hurting your feelings. But he is willing to answer your questions with good information.

name: Melanie Noname
text: I have been to this range several times and have always had a great experience. I see some people posting about strictness but it is a gun store as well as a range and I feel like I am safe there due to the rules that have been put into place. It definitely can't be run like a car wash with just anyone coming in and out of the range area. Will be returning probably many times over!!

name: Jonathan Crook
text: Great man. Major knowledge with guns and safety. Offered to help improve my accuracy. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!

name: Ryan Caffee
text: Excellent service if you don't want to be lied to. Robert tells it how it is, and has very very reasonable prices. He's got a return customer out of me.

name: Chris Taylor
text: The owner is very responsible and cares for the safety of his customers. As long as you have proper experience with firearms or you are with someone who has the proper experience to watch over you, you will have a good time. Love shooting my pistol here, the prices are much better than other places I’ve seen and the range is great.

name: Lady Momma
text:
The range was not bad, location was convenient for me. I am dreading the summertime. I read about the heat, but I guess I will have to drink plenty water before going and extra after.
Robert, seem to be a straightforward character and  I respect that. Some people can't handle straightforward considering the reviews. I will say get your own opinion before making a judgement. If you don't like his rules go somewhere else. I don't think there are many places.

name: Clark Griswold
text: My friends and I were looking for a place to shoot in Mobile and found Roberts Gun Rack.  Rober was very friendly and answered all our questions. Priced are good.  Military friendly.  Great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.  We will be back without a doubt.

name: chinelle hooker
text: I always have a wonderful experience at Roberts gun rack! I feel welcomed every time. This is the only range I choose to shoot at. Staff is always friendly and ready to help! Go see Roberts for all your shooting needs!

name: Brooke Carney
text: I always have a wonderful experience at Roberts gun rack! I feel welcomed every time. This is the only range I choose to shoot at. Staff is always friendly and ready to help! Go see Roberts for all your shooting needs!

name: kane blackstock
text: Great place to shoot. Has strict rules for range and it makes it very safe and comfortable.  Very nice range and very knowledgeable if you have questions.  I recommend purchase and range use there.

name: kevin pham
text: Go with experience or an experienced individual and you will have a flawless visit. Robert has a great shop as well as his personality. Very informative and knowledgeable owner. I enjoy every visit.

name: John R
text: This guy knows his stuff. Most knowledgeable gun shop owner in Mobile, he'll tell you the truth whether you like it or not. He will always try to steer you in the right direction.

name: Matthew
text: I enjoy shooting here. Robert takes safety serious and doesn't let knuckle heads in his range. Be honest with him about your experience and you'll be just fine. Try and pull the wool over his eyes and he'll see right through it.

name: Alexander Weber
text:
Great range. Very knowledgeable owner. And good selection of pistols and rifles.
Also owner prefers experienced shooters.

name: Marcus French
text: Im a u.s marine, brought the family to shoot but since some them havent shot 1,000x they were “allowed” to shoot there. Only me. So we all left. Waste of time. If they a newbies.. where else are ppl supposed to learn?

name: Oreo Jumper Guinea Pigs
text: Robert is a good guy.  Fun time today shooting target practice.   Hot as heck in that range.   Sweating like I been swimming for days.

name: Tamicheal Brown-king
text: I went for the first time today and it was the best experience at a gun range I ever visited. The staff its knowledgeable and very friendly. I love the fact its big boys rules on the range but safety first every person I met was nice I plan on going twice a month. Highly recommended.

name: albert nelson
text:
Military friendly and very knowledgeable of the law.  Indoor range is a plus.  Owner goes out of his way to help you with your gun needs.

Good selection and good prices, but will order what you need if he doesn't have it in stock

name: Hallie Hall
text: First time at a shooting range and loved it! Staff was great at educating me and giving me all the tips I needed before shooting. Will definetly be coming back!

name: Jacob S
text: I've been going to this range and have known Robert for about a year now and I have always been more than happy with my experience here.  Robert is very serious about gun safety which I view as a good thing.  If you ever have any problems with the range or with something that you have purchased in the store Robert is more than happy to do whatever is necessary to fix it.  I have been coming here fairly regularly for about a year now and I plan to continue to do so.

name: Nakiya McMillian
text: This was my first time at a shooting range. Robert was very friendly. and extremely knowledgeable. My fiance and I could not have asked for a better experience.

name: Method
text: Robert is a good dude. After reading a few of the previous reviews I went up there expecting to meet a much different character. Robert is SUPER knowledgeable and wound up selling me a shotgun. All of the people on here crying racist are probably just people he weeded out through some very simple questions on experience and safety. My only gripe is that the range was too small to fire my new shotgun, but I knew that going in. If you need experience or advice on a specific weapon purchase, I'd suggest going here and skip the mass retail outlets.

name: Shawn Hester
text: Robert and his staff were great in helping me purchase my first gun. It took a little longer than I would have expected however, with the circumstances surrounding the time of this review and my purchase, I have no hard feelings. He was very professional and very knowledgable about his merchandise. He also seemed to have no problem answering my 10+ phone calls inquiring about the arrival of my gun.He was always willing to answer my questions and give me the information I was seeking when I called. Would definitely and will go back and do business with Robert again.

name: Galen Edwards
text: I have been there several times by myself, with my wife, or with a group of friends.  The range is nice, Robert has helped me out several times when I needed stuff, his prices have always been good, and he is a genuinely nice and funny guy.  I have stopped in just to say hey sometimes and drool over the guns for sale.  I go there for everything.  If you are looking for an FFL or a range I cannot recommend him strongly enough.  As an additional bonus he helps out military personnel a lot.

name: Zachary Tomes
text: Havent been in quite some time due to lackluster and rather unappealing experiences in just the shop alone, but as a vocal consumer and someone who will live up to the "Local Guide" title, I cannot reasonably recommend this shop or range unless you absolutely have no other choice. From an owner who mindlessly goes on tangents to hear himself speak, to hilariously bad arguments with customers, on matters such as, if I remember correctly, M-14s not existing. The only marginal benefit to this place was his stock of 7.62x54r ammo crates, which were overpriced by all means, but convient. Personally, Id recommend going to Bullseye out in MS if you want to spend a fun day at the range. Great damn people and staff there, a good amount of guns to rent, and plenty of shooters more than willing to share a few rounds from their purdy pieces with others. Thats my two cents.

name: Christopher Forbus
text: I have really enjoyed my experience of buying my first handgun, and getting trained to use it properly. Robert is very professional and very concerned about gun safety. He is very knowledgeable and very helpful finding you a gun you will be happy with. I will continue to do business with Robert for as long as his doors are open.

name: Donna Counselman
text: Ladies Beware!!!! Worst experience with any business ever.  The only person that I saw working in the store never asked if he could help me and there were no other customers in the store.  I had driven over an hour with the intent of renting a gun to better determine what would work best for me, since I wasn't happy with my .38 special revolver.  After perusing the gun case I finally approached the worker (who never got off his rear I might add) for help.  I explained that I had read about the business online and wanted more information about renting guns and test firing on the gun range.  It was at this point that I was told there were new requirements to be able to use the range.  First requirement was to determine why I wanted to use the range.  Second requirement was that an individual had to have someone with them with a pistol permit, to which I replied that I did.  At this point it all started to seem like he was just making things up because he had decided he wasn't about to let me use the range.  He then asked how many rounds I had shot.  I explained that I had taken a course with my local police department and had spent time shooting a 9mm, a .40 caliber and my .38 special.  I told him maybe 100 rounds to which he said his requirement was 150 rounds.  He told me to bring an experienced person back with me before I could use the range. Needless to say he will never see me again and I will gladly warn all women to not even bother wasting their time.

name: Tom Green
text: For those all complaining about asking about experience, I glad he does. I once saw 2 females next to me at another gun range in Florida who damn near shot the person next to them when one pulled the trigger , got scared and pointed the gun at the guy next to them for him to take the snub nose while her damn finger still on the trigger. Thank-you robert for telling those people to   get trained first and come back. I feel personally safer......

name: Tom Green
text: For those all complaining about asking about experience, I glad he does. I once saw 2 females next to me at another gun range in Florida who damn near shot the person next to them when one pulled the trigger , got scared and pointed the gun at the guy next to them for him to take the snub nose while her damn finger still on the trigger. Thank-you robert for telling those people to   get trained first and come back. I feel personally safer......

name: Josh Garland
text:
If you do not want someone being blunt and forward with you then do not go to this store. If you want someone to be honest and straight then this is the store for you. I went in on a random idea after eating dinner. I have never been inside the rack but when I did I walked out the door with a Colt Python!

The store isn't flashy but I am completely satisfied with the out come. I plan to take my wife back to shoot on the range.

name: Douglas Kaul
text: Recently took a gun that needed repair to Robert.  He quickly figured out what was wrong, ordered some parts and fixed it. It works perfectly.  Nice job Robert!

name: Nick Rambo
text: Safety is his #1 priority. Good hand gun range. There's about 5-6 booths to shoot from with sliding targets. $1/target $15 range fee. Military gets a discount.

name: Jacob Mowry
text: I've been going up here for about 2 yrs now. Robert and his staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. I would definitely recommend to anyone in the area to check them out.

name: Richard Deloach
text: Pretty good service, also has indoor gun range which is nice living in the city. Pistols on though. But never the less good place.

name: Jason Nicholson
text: Robert's priorities are everyone's safety, and good service. Not only does he have convenient hours, but he always has ammo to shoot (even if the quantities are currently limited). Great time and will be back.

name: Anonymous
text: Don’t go in, get put on the spot by an overly dramatic guy by holding his little plastic gun with your thumb in the back. Because “you will come out of the shooting range bloody and crying, injured” and he will request someone who has “shot 100’s of thousands of rounds from a pistol” to accompany you before you can shoot there. Wow. Be sure to go in on your toes, Definitely an overly tense environment. What a shame.

name: Carl Voth
text: It is always a pleasure going to Roberts Gun Rack, He always make you feel welcome.

name: Wendell Bomar
text: Although the owner is big on gun safety (as he should be) the one thing i noticed was the lack of a range safety officer.  People were in the range room that were not shooting at that time loading and handling the firearms behind the shooters. Kind of wants to make you keep your head on a swivel. Got sprayed with scrapnel from bullets hitting the metal target hanger that were just a few feet out from the shooters to our left. Was a little apprehensive after a couple of those so we decided to leave after that. That was our first time at this range and safe to say it will be out only time.

name: ChadW
text: One of the cheapest places to shoot, usually can get in the range quickly, have always had a good experience on every occasion I have been.

name: dwashbu1
text: Love this place!! Super helpful and nice. Great prices.

name: alome chanthasinh
text: Great place, great man to deal with. Straight to the point, no BS...go check him out. 👍👍

name: Phillip Harding
text: Roberts offers fair prices for the current situation, the ability to custom order a wide variety if products, and best of all, the only indoor shooting range in town. Some may shy away from the look of the place, but i have frequented this shop for the last 2 years, and due to a strict tolerance for safety, i have not seen any unsafe behavior on the range, and that's comforting to know when sharing a range with complete strangers.

name: Gordon Seybert
text: So frustrating. I've been shooting for 20 years, never been told I am irresponsible. I am very serious about safety.   No previous "official" training = turned away. I really hate this guy... Wouldn't buy a cotton patch from him.

name: Sherrinekia Norwood
text: Was not allowed access due to my lack of shooting experience. I was with my husband who did have experience, was still denied access. I feel like I was discriminated against, and I will not be returning.

name: J.P. Clowes
text: Great experience. I took my son shooting for the very first time. They gave a very thorough safety briefing that really took hold, and he did well.

name: Tim Jones
text: Robert's Gun Rack is a great place to shoot. Robert is very knowledgeable and is a STARIGHT-SHOOTER! CLEAN, SAFE, and AFFORDABLE!!!

name: Todd Mcnorton
text: The knowledge and experience of the owner and attention  to safety was outstanding. I will  definitely be  back.

name: tiana kimber
text: Was denied access to the range even though I am an experienced shooter while with my brother, who is a Marine. He was told he wasn't experienced enough, "no offense".

name: Lee Lane
text: Very safety oriented. I'very brought 3 new shooters there over the years and Robert personally checks to make sure they know range safety and etiquette.

name: John Paul
text: I've read alot of these reviews... was worried on how I was going to be treated. But this was my first time here.. and the gentleman Robert (owner) was very pleasant in my visit. I give this 5 stars because the location is great, the booths are very good each one has a fan that is your own to use. Your going to a shooting range.... so you should have commen sence on how to handle a firearm. I will be coming here to test my firearms from now on. Very good Robert I do appreciate your establishment and your commitment  to safety. Looking forward to come another day.

name: Frances Mendez
text: Robert is a knowledgeable guy. His primary concern is gun safety. The people that have a problem with....well, I don't want them shooting next to me!!!

name: Matt Campbell
text:
First, go to SELF DEFENSE READINESS TRAINING on Bruns Drive and pay the extra $ . Its a nicer establishment and there isnt Robert.  You will have to pass the interview but its not biased.

Second, know how to pass the "hold my fake gun" test. I wasnt thinking right and wrapped my thumbs around the back of the fake gun.. hopped in my car and was like, now why the hell did I do that and normally dont .. oh well. Waste of time. Thats why I read reviews. Hes not a racist or a jerk, just a trickster. Not everyone has somebody they can come back with like Robert recommended.  Robert instead of saying "youre disqualified" why dont you hop up and educate .

name: J. Lynn
text: Edit- Just to clear this up a little in case it wasn't Robert I spoke with. I don't know the guys name I was talking to but I was in the store less than 30 minutes and got charged over $55 for shooting the guns he "insisted" we try out. I was ready to buy a pistol for my wife but I got tired of hearing this guy talk about himself and talk to me like a child. I bought the pistol we decided on elsewhere $40 cheaper. Whoever he was, he was rude and and full of himself. I understand a business has to make money and it was my fault for not clearing it up before going back to the range, but that is not how you treat a customer if you wanna keep them a customer. I stand behind my rating of two stars because I definitely, "Disliked it." If it wasn't Robert I was speaking with I suggest he select better employees.

name: Graham Forsythe
text: I went in to order a $1,600 rifle.  While I was in there, I saw another rifle in the rack I probably would have bought out of hand.  There were two guys behind the counter, one having a conversation with a 16-year old and the other just watching.  I kept waiting for one of them to at least acknowledge me and say "I'll be with you in a minute".  After 10 minutes of being ignored, I finally walked out.  I bought the rifle at another gun shop for $60 more, but I'll gladly pay more for service.  I have two other guns I'm thinking about getting in the next year or so.  These guys didn't lose a sale, they lost a customer.

name: Robert Harrison
text: Had a great time with my daughter there today.  Very friendly, knowledgable and helpful.  Highly recommend to everyone in the Mobile area.

name: Aaron
text: Went there to teach my wife to shoot. Robert asked me questions based on mine and hers experience with pistols since I was to teach her. He allowed me to do after showing her a few more things and making sure that she fully understood everything. Even tho it took us a while to get started I'm very happy he did this to make sure that our and everyone elses safety was put first. What he was trying to get her to do today was get her over the anxsity. After 20 min of pumping herself up she finnaly did it. We both had fun and will definitely return in the near future.

name: Carolin Cruz
text: Rude and incompetent fat guy.  Worst customer service experience ever.

name: David Barnett
text: That place is a joke and so is Robert. He should  think about  what  his customers  want  and not  what  he is lusting  for. Learn  to be a salesman man.

name: David Johnson
text: Good place to shoot. Best value in mobile in my opinion.

name: David Barnett
text: That place is a joke and so is Robert. He should  think about  what  his customers  want  and not  what  he is lusting  for. Learn  to be a salesman man.

name: dena lee
text: Great gun range very professional awesome service!!!

name: Mike Rogers
text: I just got finished shooting at,Roberts gun rack. guy, would recommend it too anyone

name: Hannis “SIXGUN” Lewis
text: The proprietor,  Robert, is a friendly sort with a thorough knowledge of firearms and firearm safety.

name: Buck Creek TV
text: Have a good time every time I go, no complaints

name: Richard Sterzoy
text: Robert is great I'm there all the time .

name: Timothy Byrd
text: I have known robert for quite sometime now and have learned this... If you have a problem with him then you have a problem with yourself. Robert is very aggressive on safety and making sure you know what you are doing before you take a LOADED HAND GUN ON A RANGE WITH OTHER PEOPLE. Me being a Law Enforcement officer, I have seen other officers who can barely make the cut on the range, so officer or not, dont get your panties in a wad when he comes at you with his saftey spill. As for the retards that have given him bad reviews, like I said before, you have a problem with yourself. I read one that said he is a know it all. Well if you were there asking questions, then you must not know to much. If you do know that much, Why were you in there asking questions? Get over yourself. To the guy who said he has the only gun range around mobile so he thinks he can charge what he wants.... You sir are an idiot. There are a total of 4 gun ranges in mobile. Do some research before you pop off at the mouth degrading the way some one runs there business. The other gun ranges in mobile all charge the same amount to shoot. You too can get over yourself. I have done business with robert and many other gun stores in mobile. I prefer going to robert because he takes care of me. I may not agree with some of the things he does or the way he does things but in the end, I got what I came for and got it at a good price with friendly service. If you want to go somewhere that they kiss your a$$ and tell you what you want to hear, dont go to Roberts. If you want to go somewhere that will be blount, give you an honest OPINION, and invite you back to talk guns and gear... Check him out.

name: Sonny Ortiz
text: Place was very safety oriented.  Good shooting area

name: Tiffany Roberts
text: I drove over an hour to come shoot. I was immediately interrogated with questions like "Have you ever taken a course?," "How many rounds have you shot through the pistol you brought?" etc. etc. I have a lot of shooting experience but at the time had not taken an official course. He told me some random story about a woman blowing her thumb off. Then he told me to leave and "come back with my dad." I am a grown woman, and my dad lives 200 miles away. There wasn't a single other person in there. Even if I wasn't very experienced, he could've taken the time to teach me, but I guess he was just too lazy or too sexist.

name: Mobile Bay Ballistics
text: Like GUNS, GEAR, AND SURVIVAL?  This is the place to go to learn about firearms (and buy a few while your at it) And follow Mobile Bay Ballistics on Instagram (follow for follow)

name: Steve Douglas
text: Great range to sharpen the skills.

name: Joe Taylor
text: Fat boy denied me because I didn’t look like I had experience. Even though I have shot there two times before.

name: Julio Rivera
text: Negative review. Very unprofessional. Acts like he doesn’t care for anything.

name: Mikayla Johnson
text: Very rude. Horrible attitudes/customer service. As a female, I felt extremely belittled by Robert. I will not be returning. EVER!

name: Matt Harrelson
text: The only pistol range in Mobile, the owner is very safety minded.

name: Ryan Cags
text: He said he won't sell to military unless I become a legal resident of the state. Only person I have ever talked to that said that. Brought my business to Back in Black Tactical in Lucidale, MS. Glad I went with them.

name: Aaron Johnston
text: This guy wants to act professional and "interview" people before they go and shoot.. which I'm ok with however if your store hours are from 11-7 you probably need to be there as a business owner between those stated hours. I got there at 10 till 11 and sat there until 11:15 and not a soul in sight. That is absolutely pathetic and not how a business is supposed to be ran!

name: Brian Phillips
text: Very blunt and to the point. But that's the way you need to be in this business.

name: Keng M
text: Guy behind the counter talked to me like I was a kid then told me he was gone shoot me if I brought a illegal gun in. I never mentioned anything about bringing in a illegal gun to make a long story short words where exchanged I told him he shouldn't make threats to ppl and left his shop

name: Kenyon Mitchell
text: Very helpful,good service.

name: jorge aguilera
text:
(Translated by Google) In this place they discriminate against people

(Original)
En este lugar discriminan a las personas

name: Melissa Howell
text: This is an off the beaten path shooting range located deep in the Talladega National Forest. The drive out to the range is down a long and winding dirt road. Make sure you bring what you need with you out there. A nice pit stop to the range is at Walmart in Centreville to get targets, hearing protection, ammunition etc. You may also want to use a restroom before leaving civilization since your only option will be a pit toilet at the range. Another tip is to pack all you need to carry in one trip. The walk from the parking lot to the actual range is down a steep trail covered in pine straw that you will only want to trek twice, once down and once up. There is a covered shooting area which is nice and shady. A small fee, $3.00 as of 4-29/18, is required per vehicle for you to access the range.

name: Jesse riding
text: small but quiet and cheap. usually meet some characters there but all seem like good people.

name: Clayton S
text:
Great place to shoot. The range is compact sand so it's nice even when it's wet. The shooting pavilion is nice and sturdy with several benches (for left and right-hand shooters). It seems to be well maintained other than the excessive brass laying around.

***You must bring your own target stands.

name: Clayton Scogin
text:
Great place, the only times I've been nobody else has been there.

***Be aware that you have to bring your own target stand.

name: Timothy Taylor
text: Like the South Sandy range near Duncanville, lots of trash left on the range by "sportsmen" using the range. Regulations say no skeet shooting, so naturally there are spent shotgun shells and broken clays all over the ground. Paper only range, so several plastic buckets and drink bottles scattered around. And like South Sandy, the poor road condition makes those last couple of miles an adventure.

name: Mysterykhorne
text: Me and some friends will be cleaning this place soon so please do your part to help keep it cleaned

name: Jerry Winegard
text:
This is a good place to shoot, but the steps to get to the range are downright treacherous.  They are steep, uneven and covered in dead pine needles making them slippery.  The road to the range is long and bumpy with a few places that have huge potholes and mud. I would not take your city car down this road, especially after a rain.

Payment is the honor system.  There are envelopes there for you to use and you then have a stub to place on your dash showing you paid.  It is only $3 if I recall correctly.  That is much cheaper than the fine you'll get if a ranger drives up and you didn't pay.  I have the Access Pass so I get to use the facility at no charge, but I still have to fill out an envelope.
